responses.query: What benefits are available for remote employees?
responses.answer: Based on the provided documents, which detail the "Arogya Sanjeevani Policy - National" health insurance, there are no specific benefits mentioned or differentiated for "remote employees." The documents outline general health insurance coverage available to all Insured Persons, including hospitalization expenses (room rent, ICU, surgeon fees, anesthesia, diagnostics), AYUSH treatment, cataract treatment, pre-hospitalization and post-hospitalization medical expenses, and coverage for certain modern treatments. These benefits are not tied to an employee's remote work status.

responses.decision_rationale: The provided context consists of excerpts from a health insurance policy document. I have thoroughly reviewed all pages (policy1_page_14, policy1_page_4, policy1_page_3, policy1_page_5) for any mention of 'remote employees,' 'remote work,' or any benefits specifically designated for such a category of employees. No such terms or distinctions were found. The policy details general health insurance coverage, exclusions, and conditions applicable to all 'Insured Persons' without regard to their employment type or location.
relevant_clauses: 4. COVERAGE: The covers listed below are in-built Policy benefits and shall be available to all Insured Persons in accordance with the procedures set out in this Policy. (Source 2: Documents/policy1.pdf - policy1_page_4)

4.1. Hospitalization: The Company shall indemnify Medical Expense incurred for Hospitalization of the Insured Person during the Policy Period, up to the Sum Insured and Cumulative Bonus specified in the Policy Schedule, for, i. Room Rent, Boarding, Nursing Expenses... ii. Intensive Care Unit (ICU) / Intensive Cardiac Care Unit (ICCU) expenses... iii. Surgeon, Anesthetist, Medical Practitioner, Consultants, Specialist Fees... iv. Anesthesia, blood, oxygen, operation theatre charges, surgical appliances, medicines and drugs, costs towards diagnostics, diagnostic imaging modalities and such similar other expenses. (Source 2: Documents/policy1.pdf - policy1_page_4)

4.2. AYUSH Treatment: The Company shall indemnify Medical Expenses incurred for Inpatient Care treatment under Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Sidha and Homeopathy systems of medicines during each Policy Period up to the limit of sum insured as specified in the policy schedule in any AYUSH Hospital. (Source 2: Documents/policy1.pdf - policy1_page_4)

4.4. Pre Hospitalisation: The Company shall indemnify pre-hospitalization medical expenses incurred, related to an admissible hospitalization requiring Inpatient Care, for a fixed period of 30 days prior to the date of admissible Hospitalization covered under the Policy. (Source 2: Documents/policy1.pdf - policy1_page_4)

4.5. Post Hospitalisation: The Company shall indemnify post hospitalization medical expenses incurred, related to an admissible hospitalization requiring inpatient care, for a fixed period of 60 days from the date of discharge from the hospital, following an admissible hospitalization covered under the Policy. (Source 2: Documents/policy1.pdf - policy1_page_4)

4.6. Modern Treatment: The following procedures will be covered (wherever medically indicated) either as in patient or as part of day care treatment in a hospital subject to the limit of 50% of the Sum Insured for the related modern procedure/ component/ medicine of each Modern Treatment during the Policy Period. (Source 4: Documents/policy1.pdf - policy1_page_5)
conditions_and_exclusions: List I – List of which coverage is not available in the policy (e.g., EMAIL / INTERNET CHARGES, TELEPHONE CHARGES, CONVEYANCE CHARGES, etc.) (Source 1: Documents/policy1.pdf - policy1_page_14)

6.1. Pre-Existing Diseases (Excl 01): Expenses related to the treatment of a Pre-Existing Disease (PED) and its direct complications shall be excluded until the expiry of 36 (thirty six) months of continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first policy with us. (Source 4: Documents/policy1.pdf - policy1_page_5)

6.2. First 30 days waiting period (Excl 03): Expenses related to the treatment of any illness within 30 days from the first policy commencement date shall be excluded. (Source 4: Documents/policy1.pdf - policy1_page_5)
recommendations: To determine benefits specifically for remote employees, consult company-specific HR policies, employee handbooks, or employment contracts, as this health insurance policy does not differentiate benefits based on remote work status.

If the query pertains to reimbursement of expenses like internet or telephone charges for remote work, note that 'EMAIL / INTERNET CHARGES' and 'TELEPHONE CHARGES' are explicitly listed as items for which coverage is not available under this specific health insurance policy (Source 1: Documents/policy1.pdf - policy1_page_14).
